transcript.speaker: agent
transcript.text: Good morning, this is Christopher Lee from Central Collections. I need to speak with Elizabeth.

transcript.speaker: agent
transcript.text: Elizabeth, you have a seriously delinquent account with us. $5,200 that you've ignored for months. This is your final notice before we take legal action.

transcript.speaker: client
transcript.text: I haven't ignored it! I've called three times and no one has returned my calls!

transcript.speaker: agent
transcript.text: Well I don't see any notes about that. Either way, we need payment NOW. Can you pay the full amount today?

transcript.speaker: client
transcript.text: No! I wanted to set up a payment plan, that's why I was calling!

transcript.speaker: agent
transcript.text: Payment plans are for people who respond to our calls. You've had plenty of chances. At minimum, we need $2,000 immediately or we're filing a lawsuit by tomorrow.

transcript.speaker: client
transcript.text: You can't do that without giving me proper notice!

transcript.speaker: agent
transcript.text: This IS your notice. I'm documenting this call right now. $2,000 by 5 PM tomorrow or expect legal papers. Your choice.

transcript.speaker: client
transcript.text: I want to speak to your supervisor.

transcript.speaker: agent
transcript.text: Fine, but it won't change anything. The deadline is still tomorrow. I'll transfer you, but expect to be on hold.
